channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Vermillion Cliffs Ventures launches with $13 million debut fund
item.description: Ashley Smith, previously of GitLab and GitHub, has launched Vermillion Cliffs Ventures with a debut $13 million fund, Fortune can exclusively report.

item.title: Intersex People Don’t Negate Trump’s Two-Sexes Executive Order
item.description: People with intersex conditions have long been used as the bait in the Left’s motte-and-bailey argument to declare sex mutable at will. Don’t buy it.

item.title: The Constitution Vindicates Trump’s Firing Of 17 Inspectors General
item.description: Accountability requires the power to remove. Without it, the president cannot control who wields his own executive power and how.

item.title: Uber CEO says the company is ‘well-positioned’ on autonomous vehicles—but gains are still a long way off
item.description: Chief executive Dara Khosrowshahi said Uber was "well-position" as the autonomous vehicle market heats up.

item.title: Bank of England gives hawkish warning as it cuts rates to 4.5%
item.description: The bank warned that inflation will rise “quite sharply” to peak at 3.7% later this year, up from 2.8% in the last forecast.

item.title: Newsom praises 'very productive' Trump meeting as he seeks more federal wildfire money
item.description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom visited Washington, D.C., on Wednesday to petition for more federal aid to assist in wildfire recovery.

item.title: Trump Plays a Dangerous Game with the Abraham Accords
item.description: The regional actors he needs to attract to the coalition were drawn by its focus on Iran at the expense of the Palestinian issue. So much for that.

item.title: Pro-Natal Policies Fail Because People Don’t Want Kids
item.description: The ineffectiveness of pro-natal programs suggests raising the next generation isn’t a main priority of 21st-century adults.
